info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 4:16PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cleveland, south central Gaston, northwestern York and northeastern Cherokee Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 416 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Gastonia, or 4 miles east of Kings Mountain State Park, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shelby, Kings Mountain, South Gastonia, Clover, Blacksburg, Grover, Smyrna, Kings Mountain State Park, Crowders Mountain State Park and Patterson Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
